page.title: 13West Wratting: Homelife
page.content: One resident who was interviewed lives in a little cottage with pretty pattened windows which overlooks one of the farms. He has lived there for sixty-three years and his parents were there before him. A photo of his grandfather hangs on the wall of the sittingroom. For the first time in forty-four years, since he has been keeping bees, he has no honey. He thinks it was the cold spring which kept them in the hives. In past years he has produced large quantities from a dozen or so hives, but this year, not so much as a jar. His hives need a bit of attention, but he has been too busy with his gardening jobs locally and with his own acre, that the work has been left.
